item.title: Overwatch 2's Revival of 6v6 Allows For a Hilarious Victory Pose Combo
item.description:
Summary

  • D.Va and Wrecking Ball share an identical victory pose in Overwatch 2 after 6v6 matches.
  • Blizzard reintroduced the Overwatch Classic mode for Season 14 with an expanded hero roster.
  • Overwatch 2 players await the Avatar: The Last Airbender collab starting December 17.

Overwatch 2 tanks D.Va and Wrecking Ball share an identical victory pose that's been rediscovered by players who've been enjoying the return of 6v6. Season 14 of Overwatch 2 is underway, and players have been enjoying the latest tank hero, Hazard, a member of the in-game revolutionary group known as the Phreaks. Overwatch 's annual Winter Wonderland holiday event has made its expected return to the popular hero shooter as well.

Last season, Blizzard reintroduced Overwatch 's classic 6v6 format as a limited-time side mode. Featuring only the original game's launch roster with their original ability kits, sentiment surrounding the Overwatch: Classic mode was split, as newer Overwatch players thought it felt limited, while longtime fans appreciated the trip down memory lane. Blizzard thought the mode did well enough for it to return in this current 14th season with an expanded roster of heroes, allowing players to pick some of the original game's post-launch characters, like Orisa, Sombra, Wrecking Ball, and others. It's not currently known how long this current iteration of 6v6 will remain available in Overwatch 2, though it's surely just temporary.

One Overwatch 2 player posted on Reddit highlighting a hilarious moment involving victory poses of mech-based tank heroes D.Va and Wrecking Ball. The user, palanquin_dva, posted an image of the two tanks side-by-side hitting the exact same "Peace" pose in a post-match victory screen. The pose sees D.Va, A.K.A. Hana Song, and Wrecking Ball's hamster Hammond lying on top of their respective mechs, holding up the peace sign. The only difference between the two poses is that Hana blows a bubble gum bubble in her Peace pose while Hammond does not.

D.Va And Wrecking Ball Hit The Same Victory Pose Side-By-Side After 6v6 Match

Wrecking Ball was added to Overwatch back in the summer of 2018, two years after the game's initial launch, of which D.Va was a part of. As the second mech-based Overwatch hero, Wrecking Ball was given its version of the classic D.Va victory pose, paying homage to the Korean pro gamer and one of the more popular launch tanks. Interestingly, D.Va's pose also features in one of her animated highlight intros, though the same intro isn't available for Wrecking Ball players. It would be cool to see some of the newer Overwatch 2 heroes be given highlight intros or victory poses that resemble those of the original roster members, as many of them do share similarities.

As fans are enjoying the arrival of Hazard and Overwatch 2 's festive Winter Wonderland event, they're also eagerly awaiting the game's highly anticipated crossover with Avatar: The Last Airbender . The collab will bring skins for Mei, Venture, Zenyatta, Orisa, Genji, and Kiriko, and is set to begin on December 17 and run until December 30. As for 6v6, there's currently no telling whether Blizzard will make it a permanent side mode in the arcade, or if it will return on an every-other-season basis.

item.title: CoD Black Ops 6 & Warzone: Best Maelstrom Loadout
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock The Maelstrom
  • Best Maelstrom Loadout In Black Ops 6 & Warzone
    • Best Black Ops 6 Perks & Wildcard
    • Recommended Black Ops 6 Secondary
    • Best Warzone Perks & Wildcard
    • Recommended Warzone Secondary

Black Ops 6 and Warzone are shaping up to be a solid integration, with both games receiving heaps of content for their first major update. There's quite a lot to do in both games, whether it be fast-paced action in Multiplayer or scratching that competitive itch in Warzone Battle Royale. Along their way through each mode, players can also acquire a wide range of weapons, with one solid option being the Maelstrom Shotgun.

The Maelstrom is an additional weapon that players can acquire following the Season 1 Reloaded update for Black Ops 6 and Warzone . The Maelstrom itself is the very first fully automatic Shotgun in Black Ops 6 , laying down impressive firepower for players up close. While the weapon’s range is fairly on the low side, with the best loadout it can be a rather powerful option.

How To Unlock The Maelstrom

The Maelstrom Shotgun is a mastery reward for the Merry Mayhem Event in Black Ops 6 and Warzone and can be unlocked by collecting 10 Merry Mayhem Event rewards. Unlike previous events that required completing specific challenges, this event simply tasks players with earning XP to unlock rewards. To claim all rewards, players must accumulate 618,000 XP during the event's runtime. Once done, the Shotgun becomes available for players to equip to their loadouts.

Alternatively, if players want to acquire the Shotgun early without having to rack up lots of XP, they can unlock the Maelstrom Shotgun through the Bad Manners Store Bundle. The bundle costs 1,800 COD Points , and on top of including an Operator Skin and a Blueprint for the Goblin MK2, players will also receive the Party Etiquette Blueprint for the Maelstrom Shotgun.

The Merry Mayhem Event officially ends on December 19. Once it ends, players should receive the base version of the Maelstrom Shotgun.

Best Maelstrom Loadout In Black Ops 6 & Warzone

Best Maelstrom Build:

  • Full Choke (Muzzle)
  • Reinforced Barrel (Barrel)
  • Extended Mag II (Magazine)
  • CQB Grip (Rear Grip)
  • Rapid Fire (Fire Mods)

The above build for the Maelstrom Shotgun is a great fit for both regular Multiplayer and Warzone Battle Royale. With the specified attachments, attributes such as hip-fire spread, bullet velocity, and damage range are boosted , making the Maelstrom more versatile at medium range.

Other enhanced attributes include improved CQB features like slide-to-fire, dive-to-fire, and sprint-to-fire speeds, increasing its effectiveness when firing from the hip. Finalizing this build is an extended magazine paired with an improved fire rate. While the Maelstrom may not be a top-tier meta option in Black Ops 6 and Warzone , this build significantly enhances its performance.

Best Black Ops 6 Perks & Wildcard

  • Gung-Ho (Perk 1)
  • Fast-Hands (Perk 2)
  • Double Time (Perk 3)

  • Enforcer (Specialty)
  • Perk Greed (Wildcard)
  • Scavenger (Perk Greed)

While selecting the right attachments is crucial for any loadout, Perks and Wildcards can provide powerful benefits. The Perk Package listed above uses the Perk Greed Wildcard, enabling players to equip four Perks instead of the standard three —an excellent way to gain additional advantages in combat.

For a Shotgun loadout, the recommended Perks offer significant benefits tailored to close-quarters play. These include increased sprint and tactical sprint speeds while reloading —compensating for the lack of faster reload attachments—and quicker weapon swaps to a secondary. Additional Perks extend tactical sprint duration and allow players to resupply ammunition from fallen enemies , ensuring they stay combat-ready.

Recommended Black Ops 6 Secondary

While the Maelstrom will often do the heavy lifting in Black Ops 6 Multiplayer, it is always important to bring along a solid secondary. Doing so grants players a weapon to swap to during situations where they cannot perform a quick reload during gunfights. Some great considerations for players to choose from include the Sirin 9mm and the Grekhova. Both weapons are fully automatic, providing solid damage at close range.

Best Warzone Perks & Wildcard

  • Dexterity (Perk 1)
  • Sprinter (Perk 2)
  • Resolute (Perk 3)
  • Overkill (Wildcard)

Next up is a Perk Package and Wildcard option specifically for the player's Maelstrom Warzone loadout, one which aims to overhaul the player's movement. Benefits of the Perks showcased include improved accuracy while moving , a reduction in fall damage , an indefinite tactical sprint duration , and the ability to move swiftly when taking fire. For those looking to close the distance on their enemies or break players' cameras, this Perk Package is the best option.

As for the Wildcard, there are two solid choices. The first is Overkill, allowing players to get their hands on an additional primary weapon as soon as they acquire their loadouts. On the other hand, if players want to make use of an eight-attachment build for the Maelstrom, they can consider Gunfighter.

Recommended Warzone Secondary

While the Maelstrom can be deadly at close range, its potential for medium to long-range engagements is sorely lacking. Therefore, if players want a bit of versatility in their loadout, they should consider pairing the weapon with a decent Assault Rifle to keep themselves covered against players battling them from afar. As of Season 1, meta Assault Rifles include the GPR 91 , the XM4 , the Model L , and the Krig C.

item.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Is a First-Person Game, But It’s Still a Third-Person Story
item.description:
Summary

  • Indiana Jones & the Great Circle is a first-person game for immersive experiences, putting players in Indy's shoes.
  • Despite being a first-person game, Indy still feels like a separate character narrating the story.
  • The game strikes a balance between first-person gameplay and a third-person storytelling perspective.

Ahead of its release, one of the most common criticisms of Indiana Jones and the Great Circle that still persists today is that it is a first-person game based on one of the most beloved film franchises in cinema history. Since Indiana Jones and the Great Circle stars the iconic archaeologist that many players have likely spent years seeing rather than being, the thought of stepping into Indy's shoes for a first-person Indiana Jones game might seem a bit counterproductive. However, MachineGames wanted to develop a video game that made players feel like Indiana Jones rather than simply witnessing him on an adventure, and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle does just that.

At the same time, for a character that is as firmly established as Indiana Jones, it's almost impossible for even a first-person game like Indiana Jones and the Great Circle to be entirely first-person in its storytelling and even its gameplay. While, yes, players may end up feeling like the beloved character while they play through Indiana Jones and the Great Circle , there are still some elements of the game that will be unavoidably a third-person experience. This isn't due so much to the intermittent cinematics that portray Indiana Jones in third-person, but more so, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle 's commitment to authenticity.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Still Feels Like a Third-Person Game

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Is a First-Person Game to Enhance Immersion

Regardless of how contentious a feature it may be, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle 's first-person gameplay is necessary to enhance immersion. Sure, if the game were in third-person instead, it might make players feel as though they were watching an authentic Indiana Jones film unfold before their very eyes. However, being in first-person, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle gives players the unique chance to actually be in an Indiana Jones film, rather than merely watching it, as many of those who are fans of the movie series likely have plenty of times.

For a character that is as firmly established as Indiana Jones, it's almost impossible for even a first-person game like Indiana Jones and the Great Circle to be entirely first-person in its storytelling and even its gameplay.

This effectively puts players into Indiana Jones' shoes so they can feel, hear, and see everything the character has felt, heard, and seen throughout each of the films he has starred in. With that, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle becomes a more immersive experience than it might have been otherwise, and since it's the first first-person Indiana Jones game to ever see the light of day, it helps the title to stand out in its own IP, as well as the action-adventure genre.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle's Indy Still Feels Like a Separate Character

Even though Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is a first-person game, however, it is still a third-person story. As players explore dungeons, gather artifacts, and find clues, Indy is frequently heard talking to himself, as if narrating the story and lore for the players. It can often feel as though Indy is actually telling players the story, and they are simply bearing witness to it. In that sense, even though Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is played in first-person, the story is still witnessed from a third-person perspective, so to speak, as players essentially watch Indy externally processing things as they go.

Players might technically be driving Indiana Jones as they play through Indiana Jones and the Great Circle , but at the end of the day, they are still only Indiana Jones. They don't get to be their own character, nor do they have any large-scale influence over what Indy can or can't do. Instead, they must adapt to fit who he has already been established to be in the Indiana Jones movies, thereby still making the player more of a spectator than the character they are controlling in first-person. Therefore, despite any negativity surrounding the perspective Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is played from, it still manages to strike a delicate balance between a first-person game and a third-person story.

item.title: Roblox: Horse Life Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Horse Life Codes
  • How to Redeem Horse Life Codes
  • How to Get New Horse Life Codes

Horse Life is an amazing Roblox experience where you can tame and ride lots of different horses. The game has many types of animals that you can catch and most of them are based on various mythological creatures. Also, this experience features promo codes that you can use to get free rewards. In this guide, we will list all Horse Life codes and tell you how to redeem them in-game.

Updated December 16, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: Although there are only two codes available now, we are always looking for new ones. So don't forget to check back often for updates.

All Horse Life Codes

Working Horse Life Codes

  • Uranium – Gives you x5 Green Apples.
  • MonthlyMission – Gives you x4 Master Lasso and 3 Instant Foal Potions.

Expired Horse Life Codes

  • 100ktwitter – Gives you x1 Name Tag and x1 Color Dye.

There are many ways to customize your horses in Horse Life . One of them is to give your horse a name. Of course, you can change it, and if you want to do so, you will need to use a special item called Name Tag. This thing can be obtained in different ways, including redeeming promo codes.

Codes in Horse Life can expire, just like in other Roblox games. So, if you don’t redeem them in time, you will be left without these bonuses. Don't wait too long and redeem the promo codes as soon as possible before they become unavailable.

How to Redeem Horse Life Codes

In order to use codes in Roblox games, you will need to learn how to redeem them. In Horse Life , the process can be done through a special menu, and it can be quite problematic to find. Here is a list of steps you need to follow to redeem promo codes in Horse Life and claim your rewards:

  • Launch Horse Life and wait for the experience to load.
  • After that, you will find yourself at the spawn point. There. you will need to search for a big gift with the words “Login Rewards” written above it.
  • Approach this gift and interact with it.
  • After that, you will see a menu that has two buttons on the right. Click on the Codes button.
  • Enter the code you want to redeem in the Redeem Codes tab you just opened.
  • Click on the Redeem button.

How to Get New Horse Life Codes

This guide will be updated with new Roblox codes if they are added to the game. You can use our guide as a source of information about new free bonuses. Also, you can follow the official media related to Horse Life :

  • YouTube Channel
  • Discord Server

item.title: Roblox: Flashpoint Worlds Collide Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Flashpoint Worlds Collide is a Roblox game in which you will fight crime using the superpowers of one of the best DC superheroes, the Flash. The gameplay takes place in a big city, and although it is quite empty, there are always some points of interest in it. Sometimes, you'll need to neutralize thieves, and sometimes you'll be able to take part in a race with other players. Even moving between these events is a lot of fun because you have supersonic speed.

In the game, you can buy new costumes and exchange money for extra speed. The good news is that you don't have to spend Robux because you can redeem Flashpoint Worlds Collide codes and get some free rewards.

Updated December 16, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: This guide is your ultimate source for all the latest codes. We update it frequently, so you’ll never miss out on exciting freebies. Bookmark it and stay in the loop.

All Flashpoint Worlds Collide Codes

Working Flashpoint Worlds Collide Codes

  • N3G4T1V3 - Enter this code to get Negative Flash.
  • Velocity9 - Enter this code to get 1x Velocity 9.

Expired Flashpoint Worlds Collide Codes

  • iwillrecommendflashpointtoallmyfriends
  • 
  • sorryforthewaitanddelaybutheyatleastbetaisherenow
  • 5mil
  • 100kmembers
  • 4mil
  • 3mil

How to Redeem Codes in Flashpoint Worlds Collide

In most Roblox games, you can easily redeem codes even if you enter the game for the first time. It is important for the authors not to confuse players, so they implement this function in the same way as in other titles. Therefore, experienced players quickly understand how to redeem codes in any game they enter. In Flashpoint Worlds Collide , this option is placed directly in the game interface, so even beginners will figure out what's what. However, if you still need a hint, you can simply use our guide below.

  • Open Roblox and launch Flashpoint Worlds Collide .
  • Pay attention to the block of ten buttons on the left side of the screen. Click the purple Codes button.
  • In the white box, paste a code from the list of working codes and click Redeem.

Remember that codes can quickly expire, so redeem them as soon as possible to get all the rewards.

How to Get More Flashpoint Worlds Collide Codes

Sometimes, players spend a lot of time searching for Roblox codes, and they can also be inactive. Fortunately, we regularly add and check codes in our guides so that you find the most up-to-date information here. Still, it also makes sense to visit the official web resources of the Flashpoint Worlds Collide developers:

  • Flashpoint Worlds Collide X page
  • Flashpoint Worlds Collide Discord server
  • Flashpoint Worlds Collide Roblox group
